title: Converting quotes in InDesign
content:
Does anyone know how to convert quotes in indesign cs? I want to replace “lorem” to «lorem» in imported text from word, preferably not manually. Thank you for your help and greetings from Oslo.

 [‹ kerning: all glyph combinations in a font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015143407/http:/www.typophile.com/node/13901 "Go to previous forum topic") [Cleartype hinting questions ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015143407/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14961 "Go to next forum topic")
author: alexfjelldal

comments.content:
Just use the find & replace function.

Ralf
Thank you. I did that on a book recently, and it was quite tedious work. Maybe I should ask my customers to give me the copy with proper quote marks.

Go to _Preferences \> Dictionary_ where you can set which type of quotation marks you want to use. When importing, InDesign should convert all quotation marks to the type of your choice. I think.

If your text is already imported, basically your @$$ is grass. ;-)
